item.title: Decision Tree
item.description: As the name implies, a decision tree is a tree for making decisions, especially, when you have several options to choose from. For example, a bank wants to decide whether it should provide a loan to a specific customer and it has some data about this customer. In this case, the bank could use a decision tree like the one below to make a decision: There are three major components in a decision tree: decision nodes, leaf nodes and links.
